Many methods of RunListener refer to a junit.framework.Test item. In my sit=
uation thanks to your advice I am able to call my testcases from a separate=
 Java application. I had to remove the 'extend TestCase' statement from my =
class definition to achieve that. As a result I cannot access/specify a Tes=
t item to pass to my RunListener.
A Test item could have provided a lot of =
information that I would like to include in my results reporting. 

David

=

>
> David,
> 
>=

er.  Does that help?
